intro: Amomum raoi var. oblongum, commonly known as the broadleaf cardamom, is a tropical plant belonging to the ginger family (Zingiberaceae). It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its aromatic, elliptical leaves and fragrant, three-lobed flowers. The plant produces dark brown, oblong-shaped fruits that contain aromatic seeds used in traditional medicine and culinary applications. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often cultivated for its essential oils and medicinal properties. Its botanical features make it a valuable species in both horticulture and pharmacology.
